did.abstract: Helen Maria Williams was a British novelist, poet, and translator of French-language works. Collection comprises four letters written by Helen Maria Williams, two to her nephew, Athanase Laurent Charles Coquerel, one to Mrs. Joel [Ruth] Barlow, and one to an unidentified recipient.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Helen Maria Williams was a British novelist, poet, and translator of French-language works. A religious dissenter, she was a supporter of abolitionism and of the ideals of the French Revolution; she was imprisoned in Paris during the Reign of Terror, but nonetheless spent much of the rest of her life in France.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises four letters written by Helen Maria Williams, two to her nephew, Athanase Laurent Charles Coquerel, one to Mrs. Joel [Ruth] Barlow, and one to an unidentified recipient. Williams provided aid for fellow republican radicals. On 22 August 1798, she wrote to her American expatriate friend Ruth Barlow. Williams hoped that Ruth's husband, the diplomat Joel Barlow, would assist James Wollstonecraft (Mary's brother), who was then in prison in Paris as a suspected spy. The letter notes Thomas Payne's [Paine's] ineffective efforts on James' behalf. Other topics in the letters include Coquerel's position, her income, the health and situation of friends and family members, and an unnamed woman she wishes to avoid. Three letters are accompanied by partial or full transcription.

scopecontent.p: Topic is mainly the the imprisonment of James Wol[l]stonecraft and Thomas Payne's [Paine's] efforts on his behalf. Full transcript provided.

did.unittitle: Helen Maria Williams to Athanase Laurent Charles Coquerel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter topics include Coquerel's family and position, and the health and situation of other family members. Partial transcript included.

did.unittitle: Helen Maria Williams to Athanase Laurent Charles Coquerel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics of letter include Coquerel's position, the possibility of her coming to live with him, her income, and the health of other family members.

did.unittitle: Helen Maria Williams to unidentified recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topics include the health of the recipient, and Williams' desire to meet with her, except for the possibility of also meeting an unnamed woman she wishes to avoid. Partial transcription included.
